item.title: Keegan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Howard Phillips Lovecraft
item.description: "That is not dead which can eternal lie, And with strange aeons even death may die." -- Howard Phillips Lovecraft

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Roses are red, And ready for plucking, You're sixteen, And ready for high school." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Keegan add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The sky above the port was the color of television, tuned to a dead channel." -- William Gibson

item.title: Keegan add a quote by William Gibson
item.description:
"The future is already here – it's just not evenly distributed.
<i>The Economist, December 4, 2003</i>" -- William Gibson

item.title: Keegan add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "I have dwelt ever in realms apart from the visible world; spending my youth and adolescence in ancient and little-known books, and in roaming the fields and groves of the region near my ancestral home. I do not think that what I read in these books or saw in these fields and groves was exactly what other boys read and saw there; but of this I must say little, since detailed speech would but confirm those cruel slanders upon my intellect which I sometimes overhear from the whispers of the stealthy attendants around me." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Only optimists commit suicide, optimists who no longer succeed at being optimists. The others, having no reason to live, why would they have any to die?" -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Edward Bulwer Lytton
item.description: "It was a dark and stormy night; the rain fell in torrents, except at occasional intervals, when it was checked by a violent gust of wind which swept up the streets (for it is in London that our scene lies), rattling along the housetops, and fiercely agitating the scanty flame of the lamps that struggled against the darkness." -- Edward Bulwer Lytton

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "The sadness of the world has different ways of getting to people, but it seems to succeed almost every time." -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "I hadn't found out yet that mankind consists of two very different races, the rich and the poor. It took me ... and plenty of other people . . . twenty years and the war to learn to stick to my class and ask the price of things before touching them, let alone setting my heart on them." -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline

item.title: Keegan add a quote by William Hope Hodgson
item.description: "I read, and, in reading, lifted the Curtains of the Impossible that blind the mind, and looked out into the unknown." -- William Hope Hodgson

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Algernon Blackwood
item.description: "No man can describe to another convincingly wherein lies the magic of the woman who ensnares him." -- Algernon Blackwood

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Algernon Blackwood The Willows
item.description: "I searched everywhere for a proof of reality, when all the while I understood quite well that the standard of reality had changed" -- Algernon Blackwood The Willows

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Algernon Blackwood
item.description: "The dark side of life, and the horror of it, belonged to a world that lay remote from his own select little atmosphere of books and dreamings." -- Algernon Blackwood

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Lord Dunsany
item.description: "A man is a very small thing, and the night is very large and full of wonders." -- Lord Dunsany

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Lord Dunsany
item.description: "Then I perceived, what I had never thought, that all these staring houses were not alike, but different one from another, because they held different dreams." -- Lord Dunsany

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Did you ever want to set someone's head on fire, just to see what it looked like? Did you ever stand in the street and think to yourself, I could make that nun go blind just by giving her a kiss? Did you ever lay out plans for stitching babies and stray cats into a Perfect New Human? Did you ever stand naked surrounded by people who want your gleaming sperm, squirting frankincense, soma and testosterone from every pore? If so, then you're the bastard who stole my drugs Friday night. And I'll find you. Oh, yes." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "By four o'clock, I've discounted suicide in favor of killing everyone else in the entire world instead." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "I want a tattoo over my heart that reads TRY HARDER YOU LAZY PARAMEDIC SHITBAG OR I WILL HAUNT YOUR BEDROOM FOREVER" -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Dance like you're stamping on a human face forever, love like you've been in a serious car crash that minced the front of your brain, stab like no one can arrest you, and live like there's no such thing as God." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Journalism is just a gun. It’s only got one bullet in it, but if you aim right, that’s all you need. Aim it right, and you can blow a kneecap off the world." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "What? I bring joy to the world. I am filled with mirth and sunlight. Also, I am Batman." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Keegan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Listen to the Chair Leg of Truth! It does not lie!" -- Warren Ellis
